data.summary: (Speakers) Computer Vision and Sexuality Study (Dr. Michal Kosinski & Mr. Yilun Wang)
data.description: A recently published study from Stanford claims that deep neural networks are more accurate than humans at detecting sexual orientation from facial images. This study has staggering implications, especially for individual privacy, and has sparked a great deal of discussion and controversy. Dr. Michal Kosinski and Mr. Yilun Wang, the authors of the study, will be giving a talk and Q&A session, hosted by SAIG. https://www.facebook.com/events/556558631348909/
